com.poesys.db.connection

Class PooledConnectionFactory

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.poesys.db.connection.PooledConnectionFactory
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IConnectionFactory

    public class PooledConnectionFactory
extends java.lang.Object
implements IConnectionFactory
    A factory for JDBC connections. Each factory is specific to a database and contains three connection pools: a read-only, a read-write, and an owner connection pool. The default connection pool returns read-write connections. If you need to access more than one database with a connection pool, you need to create multiple factories, one per target database. See http://tomcat.apache.org/tomcat-7.0-doc/jdbc-pool.html for complete documentation of the Apache connection pool parameters.

    TODO: Implement separate pools for read-only and owner data sources; Support DataSource as well as URL JDBC access

    Author:
    Robert J. Muller

    • Constructor Detail

      • PooledConnectionFactory

        public PooledConnectionFactory(java.lang.Integer initialSize,
                               java.lang.Integer minSize,
                               java.lang.Integer maxSize,
                               IJdbcDriver driver,
                               java.lang.String user,
                               java.lang.String password,
                               java.lang.String validationQuery)
        Create a PooledOracleConnectionFactory object. The arguments are those specific to the connection pool
        Parameters:
        initialSize - the initial number of connections in the pool
        minSize - the minimum number of idle connections to maintain in the pool after eviction
        maxSize - the maximum size of the connection pool
        driver - the name of the JDBC driver
        user - the login user name
        password - the login user password
        validationQuery - the query to use to validate a connection

      • setDriver

        public void setDriver(IJdbcDriver driver)
        Set the driver. This method controls the JDBC driver you wish to use. This is unique to the connection pool factory, which can manage a pool of connections from any database.
        Parameters:
        driver - a Poesys/DB IJdbcDriver object representing the JDBC driver

      • getConnection

        public java.sql.Connection getConnection(java.lang.String password)
                                  throws java.sql.SQLException
        Description copied from interface: IConnectionFactory
        Get a SQL connection from a DBMS to the default user on the default host using a supplied password. This permits storing the password separately from the rest of the DBMS parameters, such as in an encrypted wallet, or even prompting the user for it.
        Specified by:
        getConnection in interface IConnectionFactory
        Parameters:
        password - The user-entered password for the user
        Returns:
        the JDBC connection to the user
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - when there is a problem getting a connection
